hanzi-su-wiki:
請

Значения

Просить; принимать, получать

Мнемоника

Чистая 青, т.е. без примеси ругани речь 言. Просить надо вежливо, иначе ничего не получишь.

Варианты

请
purpleculture_pinyin:
qǐng
to ask; to invite; please (do sth); to treat (to a meal etc); to request
спросить; пригласить; пожалуйста (сделай что-нибудь); угостить (к еде и т. д.); запрашивать

(Simplified: 请)

purpleculture_examples:
請求 [ qǐng qiú ]: to request; to ask; request; Classifiers: 个
請問 [ qǐng wèn ]: Excuse me, may I ask...?
purpleculture_tree:

heisig_chinese_memo: That door to door salesman can stand outside ringing my doorbell until he's blue in the face. There's a big sign on my front door, and the words clearly say "No Soliciters Invited!".
heisig_constituent: solicit, say, words, keitai, mouth, blue, grow up, moon, flesh
koohiiStory1: People who try to solicit you to buy things come up to you and just start taking out of the blue
koohiiStory2: That door-to-door salesman can stand outside ringing my doorbell until he´s blue in the face. There´s a big sign on my front door, and the words clearly say "No Soliciting".
jp_example_words:
強請る(ねだる): to tease, to coax, to solicit, to demand
要請(ようせい): claim, demand, request, application
申請(しんせい): application, request, petition
請求(せいきゅう): claim, demand, application, request
jp_readingExamples: 請求 (せいきゅう), 請願 (せいがん), 申請 (しんせい), 請ける (う.ける), 請う (こ.う)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If what you say comes out blue, everyone knows that means you made a request. You request a favor and the words slide out of your mouth in a bright, blue blob. They hover in front of you for a few seconds, before splashing onto the person you made the request to.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this blue, slimy request. You could have done that thing by yourself, but you requested it of someone else, and now it's all over and everyone can see it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The next time someone requests something from you, take out your saber (せい) and slice it in half!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now they have the blue request gunk on them, and you can walk away as your already-blue sword absorbs the rest. Oh, and you don't have to fulfill the request (bonus!).
Ru_Notes: Просить как в прямом, так и в переносном смысле (просить о помощи, просить в гости); "принимать" жалобу, работу, но не меры.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: blue (青) words (言) must be begged for
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You can give someone words to invite them to your party until you are blue in the face, but if they don't want to go they don't want to go.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from " yan " from " blue " to " mouth ", "青" is the sound symbol, and " mouth " is used as a decorative pen. The original meaning is court meeting, court request, "Shu Wen": "Please, Ye Ye. Cong Yan, Qing Sheng." Duan Yucai's note: "Zhou Li: Chun Chao Qiu Qi. Han changed to Chun Chao Qiu. "Zhou Li• "Chunguan" princes see Wang Liuli: Spring sees the dynasty, summer sees the sect, autumn sees the call, winter sees the meeting, time sees the meeting, and Yin sees the same."

It is pronounced as " Jing " in Jin Wenyi, which means calming and calming. Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "To please (jing) Jiang, the family (yes) uses the body to obscure 㚔 (皋) 胄, to 㦵 (诛) is not smooth".

The sound of Chinese and silk scripts is almost read as " jing " and " qing ". "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Lao Zi Yi Ben": "What is his request? There is a letter in it." The current edition of "Lao Zi" is "What is his essence."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions from " yan " from " blue " to " mouth ", "青" is the sound symbol, and the " mouth " is used as a decorative pen. The original meaning is to meet.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「言」從「青」從「口」，「青」是聲符，「口」旁當為飾筆。本義是朝見、朝請，《說文》：「請，謁也。从言，青聲。」段玉裁注：「周禮：春朝秋覲。漢改爲春朝秋請。《周禮•春官》諸侯見王六禮：春見曰朝，夏見曰宗，秋見曰覲，冬見曰遇，時見曰會，殷見曰同。」

　　金文音近通讀為「靖」，表示鎮撫、安定，中山王方壺：「以請(靖)郾疆，氏(是)以身蒙㚔(皋)冑，以㦵(誅)不順」。

　　漢帛書音近通讀為「精」、「清」。《馬王堆漢帛書．老子乙本》：「其請甚真，其中有信。」今本《老子》作「其精甚真」。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「言」從「青」從「口」，「青」是聲符，「口」旁當為飾筆。本義是朝見。

  • ⿰ Left to right

①求：請求。請示。請假。請命。請戰。請教(jiào)。請願。請君入甕。請纓(喻請戰殺敵)。
②敬辭，用於希望對方做某事：請進。請坐。請安。請便。
③延聘、邀、約人來：請客。請柬。邀請。
④謁見、會見：“造請諸公，不避寒暑”。

金文從「 言 」從「 青 」從「 口 」，「 青 」是聲符，「 口 」旁當為飾筆。本義是朝見、朝請，《說文》：「請，謁也。从言，青聲。」段玉裁注：「周禮：春朝秋覲。漢改爲春朝秋請。《周禮•春官》諸侯見王六禮：春見曰朝，夏見曰宗，秋見曰覲，冬見曰遇，時見曰會，殷見曰同。」 金文音近通讀為「 靖 」，表示鎮撫、安定，中山王方壺：「以請(靖)郾疆，氏(是)以身蒙㚔(皋)冑，以㦵(誅)不順」。 漢帛書音近通讀為「 精 」、「 清 」。《馬王堆漢帛書．老子乙本》：「其請甚真，其中有信。」今本《老子》作「其精甚真」。
Bronze inscriptions from " yan" from " blue" to " mouth", " 青" is the sound symbol, and " mouth" is used as a decorative pen. The original meaning is court meeting, court request, "Shu Wen": "Please, Ye Ye. Cong Yan, Qing Sheng." Duan Yucai's note: "Zhou Li: Chun Chao Qiu Qi. Han changed to Chun Chao Qiu. "Zhou Li• "Chunguan" princes see Wang Liuli: Spring sees the dynasty, summer sees the sect, autumn sees the call, winter sees the meeting, time sees the meeting, and Yin sees the same." It is pronounced as " Jing" in Jin Wenyi, which means calming and calming. Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "To please (jing) Jiang, the family (yes) uses the body to obscure 㚔 (皋) 胄, to 㦵 (诛) is not smooth". The sound of Chinese and silk scripts is almost read as " jing" and " qing". "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Lao Zi Yi Ben": "What is his request? There is a letter in it." The current edition of "Lao Zi" is "What is his essence."

請字的基本解释

請
qǐng
见“请”。

請字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qǐng］
［《廣韻》七静切，上静，清。］
“请1”的繁体字。
(1)谒见；拜谒。
(2)请求；要求。
(3)祷祝。参见“請病”。
(4)询问。
(5)问候。
(6)告诉。
(7)召；延请。
(8)宴请。
(9)敬辞。表示自己愿意做某件事而请求对方允许。
(10)敬辞。希望对方做某事。
(11)敬辞。用以代替某些动词。表示恭敬、慎重，或使语气委婉。
(12)敬辞。特指买佛龛神像、佛道经典、礼神用品等。
(13)敬辞。其具体意义随文而异。向尊者报告情况或提出某种建议，然后请求指示。
[②]［qìng］
［《廣韻》疾政切，去勁，從。］
“请2”的繁体字。
朝会名。
[③]［qíng］
［《廣韻》疾盈切，平清，從。］
“请3”的繁体字。
(1)后又作“”。认领；接受。
(2)通“情”。实情；情况。
(3)通“情”。实在；的确。
(4)通“情”。情感。
[④]［qīng］
［《集韻》親盈切，平清，清。］
通“清1

請字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　請； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1167第18
【唐韻】七井切【集韻】【韻會】此靜切【正韻】七靜切，?淸上聲。【說文】謁也。【廣雅】求也。【玉篇】乞也，問也。【增韻】祈也，扣也。【書·湯誥】以與爾有衆請命。【左傳·僖十年】余得請於帝矣。【禮·曲禮】請業則起，請益則起。又【王制】墓地不請。【儀禮·士昏禮】?者出，請事入告。【前漢·張湯傳】造請諸公，不避寒暑。【師古註】請，謁問也。　又【爾雅·釋詁】告也。【禮·昏義】納徵請期。【註】請昏姻之期日也。　又【韻會】漢請室，請罪之室也。【前漢·賈誼傳】造請室而請罪耳。　又【集韻】親盈切【正韻】七情切，?音淸。亦謁也，祈也。又受也。　又【類篇】《前漢·賈誼傳》請室，亦讀平聲。　又【廣韻】疾政切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】疾正切，?情去聲。【說文】義同。又【廣韻】延請。　又【正韻】漢制，春曰朝，秋曰請，如古諸侯聘禮也。【史記·吳王濞傳】使人爲秋請。【前漢·宣帝紀】時會朝請。　又【韻會】朝請，漢官名。張禹首爲之。【唐書·百官志】從五品上曰朝請大夫，正七品上曰朝請

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qǐng］
["Guangyun" Seven quiet cuts, Shangjing, Qing. ]
"Please 1" in traditional characters.
(1) See you; pay respects.
(2) Request; request.
(3) Prayer wishes. See "please get sick".
(4) Inquiry.
(5) Greetings.
(6) Tell.
(7) Call; please extend.
(8) Banquet.
(9) Respect. Show that you are willing to do something and ask for permission from the other party.
(10) Respect. Hope the other person does something.
(11) Respect. Used in place of certain verbs. Express respect, prudence, or euphemistic tone.
(12) Respect. In particular, it refers to buying Buddhist niches and statues, Buddhist and Taoist classics, and ritual supplies.
(13) Respect. The specific meaning varies with the text. Report the situation to the Lord or make some kind of suggestion, and then ask for instructions.
[②]［qìng］
["Guangyun" swiftly politically cut, go hard, follow. ]
"Please 2" in traditional characters.
North Korea meeting name.
[③]［qíng］
["Guangyun" surging sharply, calm and clear, from. ]
"Please 3" in traditional characters.
(1) Later, it was also called "". Claim; accept.
(2) Through "love". The truth; the situation.
(3) Through "love". Really; indeed.
(4) Through "love". emotion.
[④]［qīng］
["Jiyun" is intimate, quiet, and clear. ]
Pass "clear 1

Name meaning

qǐng, qìng, qíng
вм. 请
Radicals: 言, 青  (say, blue)
Meaning Mnemonic
If what you say comes out blue, everyone knows that means you made a request. You request a favor and the words slide out of your mouth in a bright, blue blob. They hover in front of you for a few seconds, before splashing onto the person you made the request to.
Picture this blue, slimy request. You could have done that thing by yourself, but you requested it of someone else, and now it's all over and everyone can see it.
Reading Mnemonic
The next time someone requests something from you, take out your saber (せい) and slice it in half!
Now they have the blue request gunk on them, and you can walk away as your already-blue sword absorbs the rest. Oh, and you don't have to fulfill the request (bonus!).

Examples: 請求 (せいきゅう), 請願 (せいがん), 申請 (しんせい), 請ける (う.ける), 請う (こ.う)
二 (два), 亠 (крышка), 土 (земля), 月 (месяц), 言 (слово), 青 (голубой)
Просить как в прямом, так и в переносном смысле (просить о помощи, просить в гости); "принимать" жалобу, работу, но не меры.
請うこう
  • просить, упрашивать, умолять
    • warodai
    請けるうける
  • принимать, получать, брать
    • 要請ようせい
  • требование
    • warodai
    請求せいきゅう
  • требование, запрос, взыскание
    • warodai
    請託せいたく
  • упрашивание, мольба
    • warodai
    招請しょうせい
  • приглашение, созыв
    • warodai
    請願せいがん
  • ходатайствование
    • warodai
